sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.simpara: You can use the PDF functions in PHP to create PDF files if you have the PDF library by Thomas Merz (available at &url.pdf;; you will also need the JPEG library and the TIFF library to compile this. These two libs also quite often make problems when configuring php. Follow the messages of configure to fix possible problems.

Please consult the excellent documentation for PDFlib shipped with the source distribution of PDFlib. It provides a very good overview of what PDFlib capable of doing and contains the full and uptodate description of all functions.

All of the functions in PDFlib and the PHP module have the same name. The parameters are also identical. You should also understand some of the concepts of PDF or Postscript to efficiently use this module. All lengths and coordinates are measured in Postscript points. There are generally 72 PostScript points to an inch, but this depends on the output resolution.
There is another PHP module for pdf document creation based on FastIO's. ClibPDF. It has a slightly different API. Check the ClibPDF functions section for details.
The pdf module introduces one new type of variable. It is called pdf object and almost all functions need pdf object as its first parameter.

sect1.title: Confusion with old PDFlib versions
sect1.simpara: Starting with php V4.0.5 the PHP extension for PDFlib is officially supported by PDFlib GmbH. This means, that all the functions described in the PDFlib-manual (V3.00 or greater) are supported by php4 with exactly the same meaning and the same parameters. Only the returnvalues may differ from the PDFlib manual, as we adoptet the PHP way to return FALSE in case of errors. For compatibility reasons this binding for PDFlib still will support the old functions, but as stated above they should be replaced by their new versions. PDFlib GmbH will not support any problems arraising from the use of these depreciated functions.

row.entry: Old function
Replacement
Not needed anymore.
Not needed anymore.
PDF_get_bookmark using the same parameters.
PDF_get_value passing "font" as the second parameter.
PDF_get_value passing "fontsize" as the second parameter.
PDF_get_parameter passing "fontname" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_info passing "Creator" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_info passing "Title" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_info passing "Subject" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_info passing "Author" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_info passing "Keywords" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_value passing "leading" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_value passing "textrendering" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_value passing "textrise" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_value passing "horizscaling" as the second parameter.
Not available anymore
PDF_set_value passing "charspacing" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_value passing "wordspacing" as the second parameter.
PDF_set_parameter passing "transition" as the second parameter.
PDF_new plus an subsequent call of PDF_open_file
PDF_findfont plus an subsequent call of PDF_setfont
PDF_set_value passing "duration" as the second parameter.
PDF_open_image_file passing "gif" as the second parameter.
PDF_open_image_file passing "jpeg" as the second parameter.
PDF_open_image_file passing "tiff" as the second parameter.
PDF_open_image_file passing "png" as the second parameter.
PDF_get_value passing "imagewidth" as the second parameter and the image as the third parameter.
PDF_get_value passing "imageheight" as the second parameter and the image as the third parameter.

sect1.title: Hints for installation of PDFlib 3.x
sect1.simpara: Since version 3.0 of PDFlib you should configure PDFlib with the option --enable-shared-pdflib.

sect1.title: Issues with older versions of PDFlib
sect1.simpara: Any version of PHP 4 after March, 9th 2000 do not support versions of PDFlib older than 3.0.
PHP 3 on the other hand should not be used with version newer than 2.01. Since revision 1.61 of php3/functions/pdf.c (php 3.19) it is save to use PDFlib 3.0 or greater.

sect1.title: Examples
sect1.simpara: Most of the functions are fairly easy to use. The most difficult part is probably to create a very simple pdf document at all. The following example should help to get started. It creates the file test.pdf with one page. The page contains the text "Times Roman outlined" in an outlined, 30pt font. The text is also underlined.

example.title: Creating a PDF document with PDFlib
example.programlisting: finished"; ?>
example.simpara: The script getpdf.php just returns the pdf document.

sect1.para: The PDFlib distribution contains a more complex example which creates a page with an analog clock. Here we use the in memory creation feature of PDFlib, so we don't need any tmp-files. This example converted into PHP using PDFlib looks as the following (you can see the same example in the documentation for the clibpdf module):

example.title: pdfclock example from PDFlib distribution
example.programlisting:
<?php
$radius = 200;
$margin = 20;
$pagecount = 10;

$pdf = PDF_new();

if (!PDF_open_file($pdf, "")) {
    print error;
    exit;
};

PDF_set_parameter($pdf, "warning", "true");

PDF_set_info($pdf, "Creator", "pdf_clock.php");
PDF_set_info($pdf, "Author", "Uwe Steinmann");
PDF_set_info($pdf, "Title", "Analog Clock");

while($pagecount-- > 0) {
    PDF_begin_page($pdf, 2 * ($radius + $margin), 2 * ($radius + $margin));

    PDF_set_parameter($pdf, "transition", "wipe");
    PDF_set_value($pdf, "duration", 0.5);
  
    PDF_translate($pdf, $radius + $margin, $radius + $margin);
    PDF_save($pdf);
    PDF_setrgbcolor($pdf, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0);

    /* minute strokes */
    PDF_setlinewidth($pdf, 2.0);
    for ($alpha = 0; $alpha < 360; $alpha += 6) {
        PDF_rotate($pdf, 6.0);
        PDF_moveto($pdf, $radius, 0.0);
        PDF_lineto($pdf, $radius-$margin/3, 0.0);
        PDF_stroke($pdf);
    }

    PDF_restore($pdf);
    PDF_save($pdf);

    /* 5 minute strokes */
    PDF_setlinewidth($pdf, 3.0);
    for ($alpha = 0; $alpha < 360; $alpha += 30) { 
        PDF_rotate($pdf, 30.0);
        PDF_moveto($pdf, $radius, 0.0);
        PDF_lineto($pdf, $radius-$margin, 0.0);
        PDF_stroke($pdf);
    }

    $ltime = getdate();

    /* draw hour hand */
    PDF_save($pdf);
    PDF_rotate($pdf,-(($ltime['minutes']/60.0)+$ltime['hours']-3.0)*30.0);
    PDF_moveto($pdf, -$radius/10, -$radius/20);
    PDF_lineto($pdf, $radius/2, 0.0);
    PDF_lineto($pdf, -$radius/10, $radius/20);
    PDF_closepath($pdf);
    PDF_fill($pdf);
    PDF_restore($pdf);

    /* draw minute hand */
    PDF_save($pdf);
    PDF_rotate($pdf,-(($ltime['seconds']/60.0)+$ltime['minutes']-15.0)*6.0);
    PDF_moveto($pdf, -$radius/10, -$radius/20);
    PDF_lineto($pdf, $radius * 0.8, 0.0);
    PDF_lineto($pdf, -$radius/10, $radius/20);
    PDF_closepath($pdf);
    PDF_fill($pdf);
    PDF_restore($pdf);

    /* draw second hand */
    PDF_setrgbcolor($pdf, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0);
    PDF_setlinewidth($pdf, 2);
    PDF_save($pdf);
    PDF_rotate($pdf, -(($ltime['seconds'] - 15.0) * 6.0));
    PDF_moveto($pdf, -$radius/5, 0.0);
    PDF_lineto($pdf, $radius, 0.0);
    PDF_stroke($pdf);
    PDF_restore($pdf);

    /* draw little circle at center */
    PDF_circle($pdf, 0, 0, $radius/30);
    PDF_fill($pdf);

    PDF_restore($pdf);

    PDF_end_page($pdf);

    # to see some difference
    sleep(1);
}

PDF_close($pdf);

$buf = PDF_get_buffer($pdf);
$len = strlen($buf);

header("Content-type: application/pdf");
header("Content-Length: $len");
header("Content-Disposition: inline; filename=foo.pdf");
print $buf;

PDF_delete($pdf);
?>

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The PDF_add_outline is replaced by PDF_add_note
See also PDF_add_note.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a nested bookmark under parent, or a new top-level bookmark if parent = 0. Returns a bookmark descriptor which may be used as parent for subsequent nested bookmarks. If open = 1, child bookmarks will be folded out, and invisible if open = 0.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a launch annotation for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a launch annotation (to a target of arbitrary file type).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a link annotation for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a link annotation to a target within the current PDF file.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a note annotation for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a note annotation. icon is one of of "comment, "insert", "note", "paragraph", "newparagraph", "key", or "help".

refnamediv.refpurpose: Depriciated: Adds bookmark for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See PDF_add_bookmark.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Adds file link annotation for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a file link annotation (to a PDF target).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add an existing image as thumbnail for the current page.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a weblink annotation to a target URL on the Web.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a counterclockwise circular arc from alpha to beta degrees

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a clockwise circular arc from alpha to beta degrees

refnamediv.refpurpose: Adds a file attachement for current page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a file attachment annotation. icon is one of "graph, "paperclip", "pushpin", or "tag".

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Add a new page to the document.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Start a new pattern definition.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Start a new template definition.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a circle with center (x, y) and radius r.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use the current path as clipping path.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the generated PDF file, and free all document-related resources.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the current path.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Closes, fills and strokes current path

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the path, fill, and stroke it.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Closes path and draws line along path

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the path, and stroke it.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close an image retrieved with one of the PDF_open_image*() functions.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close all open page handles, and close the input PDF document.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Close the page handle, and free all page-related resources.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Concatenate a matrix to the CTM

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Concatenate a matrix to the CTM.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Print text at the next line. The spacing between lines is determined by the leading parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a Bezier curve from the current point, using 3 more control points.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Delete the PDF object, and free all internal resources.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Finish the page.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Deprecated, use one of the stroke, fill, or clip functions instead.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Finish the pattern definition.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Finish the template definition.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Fill the interior of the path with the current fill color.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Fill and stroke the path with the current fill and stroke color.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Prepare font for later use with PDF_setfont.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Prepare a font for later use with PDF_setfont. The metrics will be loaded, and if embed is nonzero, the font file will be checked, but not yet used. Encoding is one of "builtin", "macroman", "winansi", "host", or a user-defined encoding name, or the name of a CMap.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Fetch the buffer containig the generated PDF data.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Get the contents of the PDF output buffer. The result must be used by the client before calling any other PDFlib function.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See PDF_get_value.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See PDF_get_parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See PDF_get_value.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The PDF_get_image_height is depreciated, use PDF_get_value instead.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The PDF_get_image_width is depreciated, use PDF_get_value instead.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Get the contents of some PDFlib parameter with string type.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Get the contents of some PDI document parameter with string type.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Get the contents of some PDI document parameter with numerical type.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Get the contents of some PDFlib parameter with float type.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Reset all implicit color and graphics state parameters to their defaults.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a line from the current point to (x, y).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Make a named spot color from the current color.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current point.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Create a new PDF object, using default error handling and memory management.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Depriciated: Opens a new pdf object

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The PDF_open is depreciated, use PDF_new plus PDF_open_file instead.
See also PDF_new, PDF_open_file.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Opens a new image file with raw CCITT data

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Open a raw CCITT image.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Create a new PDF file using the supplied file name. If filename is empty the PDF document will be generated in memory instead of on file. The result must be fetched by the client with the PDF_get_buffer function.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See PDF_open_image,

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use image data from a variety of data sources. Supported types are "jpeg", "ccitt", "raw". Supported sources are "memory", "fileref", "url". len is only used for type="raw", params is only used for type="ccitt".

refnamediv.refpurpose: Reads an image from a file

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Open an image file. Supported types are "jpeg", "tiff", "gif", and "png". stringparam is either "", "mask", "masked", or "page". intparamis either 0, the image id of the applied mask, or the page.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See also PDF_open_image,

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Open an existing PDF document for later use.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Prepare a page for later use with PDF_place_image

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See PDF_open_image.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See also PDF_open_image,

refnamediv.refpurpose: Places an image on the page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Place an image with the lower left corner at (x, y), and scale it.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Draw a rectangle at lower left (x, y) with width and height.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Restore the most recently saved graphics state.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Rotate the coordinate system by phi degrees.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Save the current graphics state.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Scale the coordinate system.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets fill and stroke color to CMYK values

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current color space and color. type is "fill", "stroke", or "both".

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current dash pattern to b black and w white units.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the flatness to a value between 0 and 100 inclusive.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current font in the given size, using a font handle returned by PDF_findfont

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets drawing and filling color to gray value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current fill and stroke color.

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Depreciated, use PDF_setcolor instead.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets filling color to gray value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current fill color to a gray value between 0 and 1 inclusive.

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Depreciated, use PDF_setcolor instead.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets drawing color to gray value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current stroke color to a gray value between 0 and 1 inclusive

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Depreciated, use PDF_setcolor instead.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the linecap parameter to a value between 0 and 2 inclusive.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the line join parameter to a value between 0 and 2 inclusive.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current linewidth to width.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Explicitly set the current transformation matrix.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the miter limit to a value greater than or equal to 1.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set a more complicated dash pattern defined by an array.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets drawing and filling color to rgb color value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current fill and stroke color to the supplied RGB values.

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Depreciated, use PDF_setcolor instead.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets filling color to rgb color value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current fill color to the supplied RGB values.

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Depreciated, use PDF_setcolor instead.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets drawing color to rgb color value

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the current stroke color to the supplied RGB values.

note.para: PDFlib V4.0: Depreciated, use PDF_setcolor instead.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets color of border around links and annotations

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the border color for all kinds of annotations.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets dash style of border around links and annotations

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the border dash style for all kinds of annotations. See PDF_setdash.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets style of border around links and annotations

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the border style for all kinds of annotations. style is "solid" or "dashed".

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See also PDF_set_value,

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See PDF_set_value.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Depreciated: Selects a font face and size

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated. You should use PDF_findfont plus PDF_setfont instead.
See PDF_findfont, PDF_setfont.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See also PDF_set_value,

refnamediv.refpurpose: Fills a field of the document information

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Fill document information field key with value. key is one of "Subject", "Title", "Creator", "Author", "Keywords", or a user-defined key.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Depreciated: Sets distance between text lines

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See also PDF_set_value,

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set some PDFlib parameter with string type.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the text output position.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Depreciated: Determines how text is rendered

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See PDF_set_value,

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See PDF_set_value,

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See PDF_set_paramter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set the value of some PDFlib parameter with float type.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Depreciated.
See also PDF_set_value,

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Print text in the current font and size at the current position.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Format text in the current font and size into the supplied text box according to the requested formatting mode, which must be one of "left", "right", "center", "justify", or "fulljustify". If width and height are 0, only a single line is placed at the point (left, top) in the requested mode.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Print text in the current font at (x, y).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Skew the coordinate system in x and y direction by alpha and beta degrees.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns width of text using current font

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Return the width of text in an arbitrary font.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Stroke the path with the current color and line width, and clear it.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Translate the origin of the coordinate system.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Opens an image created with PHP's image functions

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See also PDF_close_image, PDF_place_image.
